definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]
to cultivate/to breed/to foster/to nurture/to educate/to groom (for a position)/education/fostering/culture (biology)
to provide for the elderly (family members)/to enjoy a life in retirement
to take good care of (or conserve) one's health/to keep in good repair/to maintain/maintenance
to cultivate/to raise/to form (a habit)/to acquire
to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
to feed (a child, domestic animal etc)/to keep/to raise (an animal)

sentences.english: Upon Duke Ning's death, his son Jia Daihua succeeded him on the official position.
sentences.chinese: 宁公死后，贾代化袭了官，也养了两个儿子。

sentences.english: Let the woman keep, not equal to practiced a sunflower treasure Dian to calculate from the temple.
sentences.chinese: 让女人养吧，不如自宫练葵花宝典算了。

sentences.english: You truly are eating and drinking for two.
sentences.chinese: 你是真正地一人吃喝养两个。

sentences.english: Keep a rosemary plant in your office.
sentences.chinese: 在办公室养一盆迷迭香。

sentences.english: One of the first things you need to consider in owning a new kitten is their litter training.
sentences.chinese: 养一只小猫，你需要首先考虑的是进行猫砂训练。

sentences.english: It is now the standard of living increased, many people have pets.
sentences.chinese: 此刻人们糊涎水平提高了，人们都养宠物。

sentences.english: I had a little yellow parakeet when I was young.
sentences.chinese: 我年轻的时候养了一只黄色小鹦鹉。

sentences.english: The people raised you up, what will you do in return?
sentences.chinese: 是人民在养你们，你们自己看着办。

sentences.english: We keep a few fowls and some goats.
sentences.chinese: 我们养了几只鸡和一些山羊。

sentences.english: Scientists can observe how organisms work together in low-energy sites.
sentences.chinese: 科学家可以观察有机体在低能养地区如何互动。

sentences.english: She say you better not fuck on the table, you son of a 'beach'.
sentences.chinese: 她说，你最好不要在盘子里小便，你个表字养的。

sentences.english: From today's blog we will start to nurture this child.
sentences.chinese: 大家从今天的博客开始我们一起来养。

sentences.english: Farcinia is spreading seriously and those families which raise cattles must take measures against it.
sentences.chinese: 疽病传染严重，养家畜的家庭一定要做好防范。

sentences.english: My cousin has a pet rat.
Petting pets has been shown to reduce blood pressure and heart rates in adults.
sentences.chinese: 养宠物的成年人血压和心率都比较低。

sentences.english: But I drink tea, also is flowers and plants can raise the body.
sentences.chinese: 可是我喝的是花草茶，也可以养身体。

definition: to feed (a child, domestic animal etc)/to keep/to raise (an animal)
to provide for/to keep (animals, a family etc)/to raise animals/to feed and clothe/support/the necessities of life/to give birth
to breed (livestock, fish, crops etc)/to grow/to raise
native dog/mole cricket (colloquial word for agricultural pest Gryllotalpa 螻蛄|蝼蛄[lou2 gu1])
to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
to rear (an animal) in an enclosure
